content: Overall, we achieved an 11.3% increase in our third quarter adjusted EBITDA of $57.3 million compared to $51.5 million last year. Net sales in wholesale increased $165 million or 11.3% to $1.63 billion in the third quarter, driven primarily by the favorable impact of inflation, which exceeded 14% in the quarter. The increase in reported operating earnings was due to higher sales and lower supply chain expenses, partially offset by higher corporate administrative costs and LIFO expense, which rose $8 million in the current quarter. Retail sales came in at $667 million for the quarter compared to $609 million in the third quarter of 2021, an increase of 9.5%. This update to our adjusted EBITDA and EPS profitability ranges recognizes the benefits from our supply chain transformation and ongoing solid growth, but itâs tempered by retail margin headwinds and the impact of our Merchandising Transformation investments. And ask you â I mean, consolidate expenses showed good leverage, but as I kind of just sort of parsed through it, it appears to me that itâs a little more skewed towards the wholesale side of the business with obviously throughput has a leverage â big leverage as well as some of the supply chain expense, although I guess that could go to retail.
